function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The checkout page displaying a summary of the cart with two items, options for entering customer and address information, and selecting a payment method. The checkout form is partially filled with the first name 'John', and the rest of the customer, address, and payment information fields are empty. There's a submit button for completing the transaction. The top navigation menu allows navigation to different product categories.","explanation":"Continue filling out the checkout form by entering the email address and then proceed to fill in the address information. After the entire checkout form is filled, attempt to complete the transaction by submitting the form. This process will help in evaluating the form submission and interaction with the payment gateway or error handling mechanisms.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":r1i:","keys":"john.doe@example.com"}}

messages.content: Given a web application, you are tasked with assisting in testing its functionality. The emulate_interaction function takes an interaction as input and emulates it on the web application. The return value of the function is the new, filtered HTML source code of the web application. The source code of previous interactions will be omitted from the input to the assistant.
Here are some examples how the 'emulate_interaction' function should be used.
Please test my website: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description": "The start page of a web site with multiple calculators for different purposes. There are buttons to navigate to the differet calculators and a button to switch the language of the web site. The current language is English.", "new_testing_goal": "Test the calculator for calculating the area of a circle in multiple languages.", "explanation": "First navigate to the calculator for the area of a circle. Then input a radius and calculate the area. Switch the language of the web site and repeat the process.", "interaction": {"interaction_type": "click", "element_id": "btn-area-circle"}}

messages.content: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases. Here is the filtered HTML source code of the web application: 'omitted'.

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The web application now shows the Galaxy product category page, including a variety of Galaxy smartphones with details and 'add to cart' buttons for each. The navigation bar at the top offers links to different sections such as Home, Galaxy, S10, M Series, and A Series. A cart icon indicates that there is one item in the cart. The cart overlay is currently closed, but there is an option to open it.","new_testing_goal":"Navigate to the 'M Series' category and add a product to the cart. This will test the web application’s ability to handle adding different types of products to the cart and updating the cart's item count and total cost accordingly.","explanation":"To navigate to the 'M Series' category, click on the 'M Series' link in the main navigation. Once in the 'M Series' category, choose a product and click on its 'add to cart' button. After adding the product, observe how the cart updates to reflect the addition of the new item, paying particular attention to the cart's item count and total cost.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":r0:-m_series"}}

messages.name: emulate_interaction
messages.content: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The web application has successfully navigated to the 'M Series' products page, showcasing affordable phones with great battery life. Three products are listed: Galaxy M30, M20, and M10, each with an 'add to cart' button. The navigation menu offers access to home, Galaxy, S10, M Series, and A Series sections. A cart icon shows there is currently one item in it. Also available is a cart overlay option for viewing cart contents.","new_testing_goal":"Add a Galaxy M series product to the cart and check the cart's functionality regarding item count and total cost update. Subsequently, explore other sections and add more products to test the cart's handling of multiple items.","explanation":"Click on the 'add to cart' button for one of the M Series products, for example, the Galaxy M30, to test the add to cart functionality and observe how the application updates the cart. After adding the product, open the cart overlay to check the item count and total cost. Then proceed to add items from another category to ensure the cart can handle multiple types of products.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":"6:r11:"}}

messages.name: emulate_interaction
messages.content: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The web application is currently displaying the cart with two items in it: Galaxy A2 Core and Galaxy M30, indicating a successful addition of products from different categories. The cart shows detailed information for each item, including images, names, prices, options to remove the item or adjust its quantity, with the total cost of the cart being displayed at the bottom. There are also options available to clear the cart or proceed to checkout. Additionally, the main navigation menu is visible, offering the ability to navigate back to product categories such as Home, Galaxy, S10, M Series, and A Series.","new_testing_goal":"Proceed to checkout and simulate a purchase to test the checkout functionality and the application's response to completing a transaction.","explanation":"To proceed with testing the checkout functionality, first, interact with the 'Checkout' button to navigate to the checkout page. There, fill in the necessary customer information, select payment options if available, and complete the purchase. This process will help assess the efficiency and user-friendliness of the checkout process, including form validation, error handling, and successful transaction confirmation.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":r8:"}}

messages.name: emulate_interaction
messages.content: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The checkout page of a shopping web application. It displays a summary of the cart including a Galaxy A2 Core and a Galaxy M30 along with individual prices and a total cost. There are sections for entering customer information (First Name, Last Name, E-Mail), address (Country, Street Address, City, State, Zip Code), and choosing a payment method (Invoice, Credit Card, PayPal). A submit button is available for completing the transaction. The navigation menu allows returning to products categories.","new_testing_goal":"Complete the checkout process by filling in all required customer, address information, selecting a payment method, and submitting the form. This will test the web application's handling of the transaction completion.","explanation":"Fill in the customer information form fields, including the first name, last name, and email. Follow with the address information including country, street address, city, state, and zip code. Choose a payment method, then click the submit button to complete the purchase.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":r1g:","keys":"John"}}

messages.name: emulate_interaction
messages.content: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The checkout page displaying a summary of the cart with two items, options for entering customer and address information, and selecting a payment method. The checkout form is partially filled with the first name 'John', and the rest of the customer, address, and payment information fields are empty. There's a submit button for completing the transaction. The top navigation menu allows navigation to different product categories.","new_testing_goal":"Fill in the last name and email address fields to continue testing the checkout process. After successfully filling these fields, proceed to fill in the address information and select a payment method. This step is crucial for testing the form's responsiveness and the completion of the checkout process.","explanation":"Fill in the last name in the respective field and the email address in its field. This step is part of the process to ensure that all necessary information is provided for the checkout process. After completing these fields, address information will be next, followed by selecting a payment method and submitting the form.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":r1h:","keys":"Doe"}}

The user provided the following end instructions: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases.

Pursue your self-assigned sub-goal or assign a new one: Fill in the last name and email address fields to continue testing the checkout process. After successfully filling these fields, proceed to fill in the address information and select a payment method. This step is crucial for testing the form's responsiveness and the completion of the checkout process..

Previously executed interactions by goal: {"Test the shopping cart functionality by adding products to the cart and checking out.": 3, "Proceed to checkout and test the checkout process for completeness and any potential issues.": 1, "Complete the checkout process while testing form validation and response to incomplete inputs.": 1, "Verify form validation by submitting an incomplete form.": 1, "Test the responsiveness of the form to incomplete submissions and ensure error handling is in place.": 1, "Submit the checkout form with incomplete address information to test form validation and response.": 1, "Attempt to submit the checkout form with essential information missing, to observe the website's handling of incomplete submissions.": 1, "Adjust the cart contents by removing items and changing quantities, then revisit the checkout process.": 1, "Increase the quantity of Galaxy S10+ in the cart, then proceed to fill in the remaining mandatory address information.": 1, "Complete filling the address information, select a payment option, and attempt to submit the checkout form to observe the final validation and submission process.": 1, "Fill in all the required address fields, select a payment option, and submit the form to complete the checkout process.": 1, "Fill in the State and Zip Code fields, select a payment option, and then attempt to submit the checkout form.": 1, "Fill the missing Zip Code field, select a payment option, and submit the checkout form to validate the entire checkout process.": 1, "Complete the checkout process by selecting a payment method and submitting the form. Ensure the form's submission is properly handled, and any confirmation or error messages are observed.": 1, "Explore the functionality of the clear cart button and navigate the store to add new items to the cart.": 1, "Explore the website's product range by navigating through the various product categories available in the main navigation. Add products to the cart from different categories to test the cart's functionality in adding and displaying items.": 1, "Add a product from the 'Galaxy' category to the cart to test the add to cart functionality, including the cart's ability to update the item count and display the correct total cost.": 1, "Navigate to the 'M Series' category and add a product to the cart to test the website's ability to handle multiple types of products in the cart. This will help in assessing the cart's functionality when dealing with varied items simultaneously.": 1, "Navigate to the 'M Series' category and add a product to the cart. This will test the web application\u2019s ability to handle adding different types of products to the cart and updating the cart's item count and total cost accordingly.": 1, "Add a Galaxy M series product to the cart and check the cart's functionality regarding item count and total cost update. Subsequently, explore other sections and add more products to test the cart's handling of multiple items.": 1, "Proceed to checkout and simulate a purchase to test the checkout functionality and the application's response to completing a transaction.": 1, "Complete the checkout process by filling in all required customer, address information, selecting a payment method, and submitting the form. This will test the web application's handling of the transaction completion.": 1, "Fill in the last name and email address fields to continue testing the checkout process. After successfully filling these fields, proceed to fill in the address information and select a payment method. This step is crucial for testing the form's responsiveness and the completion of the checkout process.": 1}.

Start by describing the website supplied by the function call. Give a short general description first then summarize the main elements on the website. Do not use HTML in your description. Then you may formulate a high level sub-goal to the user's instructions, that should be persued with the next couple of interactions. You should formulate a new sub-goal if the current one has been completed or seems to be unattainable. Give an action plan that explains how the goal should be reached. And finally, describe the interaction to emulate.

Only use the click action with clickable elements. The clickable elements have the following ids: :r19:, :r0:-home, :r0:-galaxy, :r0:-s10, :r0:-m_series, :r0:-a_series, :r1:, :r2:, :r1a:, :r1b:, :r1c:, :r1d:, :r1e:, :r1f:. Only use the send_keys action with writable elements. The writable elements have the following ids: :r1g:, :r1h:, :r1i:, :r1j:, :r1k:, :r1l:, :r1m:, :r1n:. Only use the clear action with clearable elements. The clearable elements have the following ids: :r1g:, :r1h:.

functions.name: emulate_interaction
functions.description: Emulates a user interaction with the web application

page_description.description: A short textual description of the state of the web application: What is the current page? What are the main elements on the page? This description should not contain any HTML.

new_testing_goal.description: Assigns a new high level sub-goal that shall be followed in order to complete the users instructions. This goal should take multiple user interactions to complete. The assistant shall try to complete this goal in the next couple of interactions and then assign a new one.

explanation.description: An action plan that explains how the goal should be reached.

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

keys.description: the keys to be sent to the input element

anyOf.description: sends keystrokes to an html element

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

anyOf.description: resets the contents of an html element
